case_vignette: A 13-year-old female comes to your office complaining of dry, scaling skin (FIgure A). She is particularly concerned about the appearance of her skin around her peers. She indicates that she did not start having problems until she was 5 years of age, after which her skin has progressively become drier and scalier. She has tried all types of over-the-counter moisturizers with no resolution.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
My skin is very dry and scaly.
Have you noticed any itching or redness on your skin?
No, there's no itching or redness, just really dry and scaly skin.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or lifestyle?
No, I haven't made any changes to my diet or lifestyle.
Have you had any recent travel or exposure to extreme temperatures?
No, I haven't traveled recently or been exposed to extreme temperatures.
Have you had any recent skin injuries or infections?
No, I haven't had any skin injuries or infections.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin color or texture?
Yes, my skin has become progressively drier and scalier over time.
Have you noticed any changes in your weight or overall health?
No, my weight and overall health have been fine, it's just my skin that's the problem.
Have you noticed any changes in your sleep patterns or stress levels?
No, my sleep and stress levels have been the same.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin care routine or products?
I've tried all types of over-the-counter moisturizers, but nothing seems to help.
Have you noticed any changes in your family history of skin conditions?
I didn't mention anything about my family's skin history.
Final Diagnosis: Atopic Dermatitis.
